DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response used to determine whether treatment with injections of antibodies were given earlier in time?

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Treatment with injections of antibodies made in another animal or in the laboratory._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Treatment with injections of antibodies made in another animal or in the laboratory.

Concepts.definition: Treatment with injections of antibodies to directly destroy specific, usually cancerous, cells or to stimulate the immune system to destroy those cells.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient receive prior
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive prior systemic treatment with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody, or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell costimulation or immune checkpoint pathways?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN Prior treatment with anti-programmed death-1 (anti-PD-1) or anti-programmed death-ligand 1 (anti-PD-L1) therapeutic antibodies is allowed as is prior therapy with other immunotherapies

ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior anti-PD1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy administered
